documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
RESPONSES
We can now examine the way in which those who adopt the liberal or “pro-
choice” position will respond to the conservative or “pro-life” argument as
it has just been spelled out. The second premise should not be a subject for
controversy, given our definition of abortion. Nor does it seem likely that the
fourth premise will be attacked on the ground that the fetus is not innocent.
How could a fetus be guilty of anything?
This leaves three strategies for the liberal: (1) Further modify
